text: Hello ember community. My name is Mark, looking at learning some of the ropes of ember over the next 3 weeks. If anyone can suggest some great places to start learning it I would appreciate that :simple_smile:
hey <@U065NAMB8> i think this book is really great <https://leanpub.com/ember-cli-101>

attachments.title: ember-cli 101
attachments.text: ember.js book - tutorial - Learn to write Ember.js apps with ember-cli.

text:
as <@U043951H9> mentioned that’s a great book, I’d also recommend ember weekly to keeping up to date <http://emberweekly.com/>
and I made a small post on acceptance testing for ember-cli apps, showing more or less the same workflow you’d have in rails when doing E2E testing with capybara :simple_smile: <http://mariogintili.svbtle.com/acceptance-testing-ember-cli>

attachments.title: Ember Weekly Newsletter
attachments.text: A free, weekly email newsletter containing the latest Ember.js news, tips & code.

attachments.title: Acceptance testing in Ember-CLI, an introduction.
attachments.text: The only form of tests you can’t really live without are acceptance tests, they always ensure that requirements are met, and almost always expose flaws. Today we will (try to!?) cover the basics of acceptance testing in Ember-CLI Apps, Involving... | mario gintili | Software developer, London, UK.
attachments.fallback: Rocket science on Svbtle: Acceptance testing in Ember-CLI, an introduction.

text: ah thanks <@U043951H9> and <@U047GTU64> these are great
